str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Ephesus, a coast city, capital of the Roman province Asia. Probably of foreign origin; Ephesus, a city of Asia Minor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
This here, this, that, he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From kratos; to use strength, i.e. Seize or retain.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Seven. A primary number; seven.
A star. Probably from the base of stronnumi; a star, literally or figuratively.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
On the right hand, right hand, right. From dechomai; the right side or hand.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Seven. A primary number; seven.
Golden, made of gold, adorned with gold. From chrusos; made of gold.
A lamp-stand. From luchnos; a lamp-stand.
